question: How does the Glover equation differ conceptually from the Ghyben–Herzberg relation? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Glover extends the hydrostatic Ghyben–Herzberg concept by describing a spatial interface profile and explicitly accounting for seaward freshwater flow.
error: ❌ Review the conceptual difference: Glover includes spatial variation and freshwater flow, while Ghyben–Herzberg is a local, hydrostatic relation.

question: In the Glover formulation for a sharp interface in a coastal aquifer (no pumping), which of the following changes will tend to increase the inland extent or thickness of the freshwater body (all else equal)? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Stronger freshwater flow, a thicker aquifer, and a smaller density contrast all favor a more extensive freshwater body.
error: ❌ Think about which changes strengthen freshwater dominance against seawater intrusion in the Glover sharp-interface framework.

question: Which of the following are standard assumptions of the Glover (1959) solution? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. The Glover solution relies on a sharp interface, simplified freshwater flow (Dupuit), and idealized aquifer conditions.
error: ❌ Remember that Glover is a simplified analytical solution and does not resolve dispersion or detailed vertical flow.

question: In the steady-state Glover solution for a sharp freshwater–saltwater interface in a coastal aquifer (no pumping), which parameter change will increase the depth of the interface beneath the shoreline, without changing the aquifer thickness? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. A larger seaward freshwater gradient pushes the interface deeper beneath the shoreline in the Glover model.
error: ❌ Focus on how the freshwater hydraulic gradient controls the interface position at the coast under steady-state conditions.

question: In the Glover model, what is the key simplification made about groundwater flow in the freshwater zone? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Freshwater flow is simplified as predominantly horizontal using the Dupuit approximation.
error: ❌ Recall that the Glover model assumes mainly horizontal freshwater flow rather than fully 3D dynamics.

question: Compared to the Ghyben–Herzberg relation, what additional insight does the Glover solution provide for coastal aquifer management? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. The Glover solution provides spatial insight into interface geometry and shows how freshwater flow conditions control seawater intrusion.
error: ❌ Recall that Glover extends the Ghyben–Herzberg concept by linking freshwater flow to the interface shape, but still assumes a sharp interface without dispersion.
